content.label: I got it on day one. But i can't believe there is no reviews.

name.label: G e r e m y

content.label: It was always one of the greatest iOS games and this new unexpected update it's now even better!

While it's not an entire multiple hour game like Pixel's other game Cave Story, but for a mobile game it is fantastic. The weapons are well made and the damage is really balanced. The level design is great and pulls a Mega Man X and teaches you game mechanics by introducing a harmless challenge, and then implementing the same idea in a more risky, dangerous situation. The game doesn't feel unfair; every challenge is laid out before you, and you're left to figure out the best route. The game doesn't hold your hand and some enemies can be challenging if you don't use the right weapon for the right situation. The challenge is similar to Castlevania; the game follows a completely linear path and has planned enemies at certain points. There's no RNG that spawns different monsters in different areas, so the game is more about skill and spatial awareness than having to try and get your character as strong as possible to plow through levels. The bosses are interesting and fun, I definitely don't mind losing a few times before I get the pattern down.

That's really my only complaint, the game is simply too short and there aren't too many weapons. The graphics and art are great, and the NPCs are entertaining and have interesting and sometimes comical things to say. The "President's" dialogue is great. 

I would say if you're looking for an old school experience and you enjoyed Cave Story, you'll love this. As well known and loved as Cave Story is, I'm a fan but don't consider it one of the best indie games ever made... I am still a fan and glad I spent the $5 on Kero Blaster! Definitely worth the price for a single player offline action platformer.

title.label: There are extra levels! Another great game from Pixel

content.label:
Pixel made the very popular indie game, Cave Story, so when they announced Kero Blaster, it was worth getting excited for. The controls are very simple and solid, graphics are adorably retro and the music is a fun chip tune. 

This fantastic run-and-gun is a must download for indie fans. 

Don't forget to say "no" at the end for a bonus replay with all of your gear and more difficult enemies.

My only complaint is that it would be nice if MFi worked. „Åß„Åç„Çå„Å∞„Ç≤„Éº„É†„Éë„ÉÉ„Éâ„ÇÇ‰Ωø„Åà„Çã„Çà„ÅÜ„Å´„Åó„Å¶„ÅÑ„Åü„Å†„Åë„Åü„Çâ„Åô„Åî„ÅèÂ¨â„Åó„ÅÑ„Åß„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ

fun

Cave story being my favorite game of all time, I was excited to hear Pixel would be working on another game. Kero Blaster is a great mobile retro 2D Platformer/basic 2D shooter, that evokes a sense similar to that of a game like Contra with Pixel's own signature flair. The story is kept fairly basic, though it can be delved into in more depth upon closer inspection. Essentially, it centers around a frog janitor that jumps and shoots stuff in interest in protecting the cat president, who is slowly becoming more corrupted by these weird black things. All of that said, this game is very short. It has enough difficulty to be fun yet fair, though frustrating at times. Luckily, the iPhone controls are fairly well setup to avoid unfair difficulty brought on by the controls commonly found in mobile games, at least for the most part. This is a great mobile game, problems mostly just being brought on by the fact that it's too short. The gameplay experience, and story could honestly be extended significantly and it would help the game overall a lot. Kero blaster is a great mobile game. It's difficult and fun. It's just not long enough.
Okay that's a silly complaint, maybe, I know I keep saying it. But for the game we have here I think it's valid, because you CAN do a lot more with it. It's too bad that not much more was done.

This is a truly great game. The graphics, platforming, storyline, and overall experience was just exceptional. Completely worth the $5. A must have for 8-bit platformer fans. Definitely one of the best games in the App Store!
One of the most satisfying games on the App Store. Really really captures the NES days of gaming-yet also remains a Ton of fun while telling a very offbeat and funny story. Worth the price.
Really good follow up to cave story.
We want kero blaster II! This game rules hard, way worth the 5 bucks :)

title.label: g8 app m8 I r8 it 8/8

content.label: But seriously, I haven't play game with such enjoyable playability. Music, control, gameplay are simply perfect.

This game i just fell in love with. The platforming, weapons, and difficulty was all nice. I strongly recommend this game to anyone. My only compliant is how short the game is. Both me and my lil brother beat this game in about an hour. Other Then that this game is perfect
To access the mode, say no when the guy asks you if you liked the game. He'll take all your money, but you'll turn yellow and start over at Hinterland.

I'm really not exaggerating when I say this has to be the best game I've ever played on a mobile device. The thought put into this game is so in depth that I feel like the price is too low. The controls are optimal for touch, the story is well thought out, the soundtrack is first rate, and the actual gameplay is just short of perfect. A satisfying game all around. You really can't go wrong with Kero Blaster.
Very fun, last boss was fun to fight.

I'm such a fan of Cave Story and Pixel that I bought this game without even reading about it. It's amazing: the graphics are wonderful, the gameplay is addictive, and the music is great. My only two complaints are that 1) the platforming could be just a little more precise, especially since iPhone controls aren't the greatest to begin with, and 2) there are missing features. The iOS version doesn't seem to be a New Game+ even though I've read since playing the game that the computer versions have it. There's also supposedly a boss rush mode and (*spoilers*) a secret fifth weapon to mix up game play. If you're on the fence about paying $5 for this game, just know that it's definitely worth it, but your money would be better spent on the PC/Mac version of it.

I love this game, studio pixel brings yet another perfection to the platter yet I felt the game was too short. It was fun while it lasted, really fun at that. But for $5, I think it should've been just a tad bit longer.

While not as epic as Cave Story, this game has a ton of polish and for the price, delivers a good 3-4 hours of content. I would have enjoyed it more with a keyboard or controller, but still great game! Good job Pixel!
Hard games are always the most interesting games. And this one is HARD.

I cant believe im leaving 1 star, because this is quite possibly the best game ive ever played in the 8-bit world. but the 1 star is in the hopes that attention is brought to this very disappointing issue.
It takes some time, and some patience to beat this game.. so you would think as a reward you would be able to select levels for replay value once you've beaten it. you know, with all the weapons and power you've earned. not the case. 
the saving structure is not clear cut, so you end up only being able to replay the last level or the an entirely new game back at zero. 
PLEASE UPDATE with option to start new game with all upgrades.
Incredibly fun with no in-app purchases. Great controls. Pixel is a top-notch developer.

title.label: One of the best games I've played on iOS

content.label: Love it. Throw in Zelda, some Mario maybe a little megaman and a little frog named Kero and you've got this amazingly fun adventure. I'm blown away at how fluid and nice the controls are. It has a bit of a learning curve but nothing you can't handle.

I can't praise this game enough. I don't really like mobile games due to lack of physical buttons, but this one works. The platforming and gunplay are solid, the progression is fair, the music is fantastic, and the graphics have an excellent retro aesthetic. If I had one thing to complain about, it's that the game is over too quickly. But, that's not enough to detract from the great package. Get this game! You will not be disappointed.
I thought that this type of game was impossible on an iPhone but it's been done and it's so fun! I loved it.
Enjoyed reliving my childhood while playing this game. I would recommend it to anyone
The best handling I have experienced on the iPhone, exceptional level design. Replayability like classic mega man and a nicely challenging experience.

This game is a fantastic romp, paying just enough homage to games like Mega Man, and adding its own unique spin on classic platformer paradigms, to be almost instantly one of my favorite portable games. Great 2D sprite graphics, a wonderful soundtrack, fun weapons, and pretty spot-on control for a touch screen (the best I‚Äôve experienced), this game is a joy to play. Lasting about 3 hours for a full play-through, it is completely worth the entry price. That said, things like a new game+ mode, bluetooth controller support, or an iPad version would go a long way in making this delightful game even better. Now, if only a port of this dev‚Äôs Cave Story+ could find its way to the App store‚Ä¶ :)
I dont normally write reviews but this game is just glorious! when I saw its from studio pixel i JUST had to download it,  worth 5 bucks! cave story next please!

Studio Pixel is the best developer ever! From the creators of Cave Story, comes Kero Blaster! I am so glad Studio Pixel was generous enough to release an iOS port of this gem. I cannot emphasize how much fun is packed into this game. It is a bundle of joy with cute pixels and catchy chiptunes. The story is simple and lasts about 3~, but you can replay it to find the [[[SPOILER ALERT-- secret weapon, the Kuro Blaster, and get a golden character! you can also unlock a boss rush mode
that lets you challenge yourself and others on defeating all bosses in the least time!]]] 4.99 is a small price to pay for this amazing game! Kero Blaster is one of the reasons why I updated to a newer device, and that alone should convince you to buy it. Can we get Cave Story next, please?üòä

title.label: Pixel, you have done it again!

content.label: I love Cave Story. LOVE IT. But this, this is amazing. Basic gameplay mechanics anyone can learn, awesome weapons (and maybe a hidden one), tough bosses (I'm stuck on the Final Boss), and hilarious characters. The plot is amazing, and I hope Pixel makes more games like this one. Keep going, Pixel!
This game has a killer soundtrack and excellent gameplay. Really impressed with the touchscreen controls.

Studio Pixel nailed the classic platformer again with this little gem!  Great control scheme for touch-based gameplay.  I hope this game is released on Steam at some point.  I'd like to play it with a controller.
I love this game...I love the music and character designs and all of Pixel's classic boosting platforming.....
This was easily the best platformer I've played on either the iPhone OR iPad to date. Great retro graphics, decent challenge, rewarding powerups, and likable characters. Well done, Studio Pixel!!!

It's a classic platformer with the perfect amount of increasing difficulty, catchy tunes, and intuitive gameplay! This is probably the first game that requires timed jumps that hasn't been frustrating to play on an iPhone. Definitely going to the top of my favorite mobile games list!
This game made me become pretentious enough to call it a "sublime experience." I loved every bit of it. No one knows polish like pixel, I tell you what
If you love cave story you would probably love this game too
It's the best game. Plain and simple.
Great game from a great artist/developer. The controls are spot-on for a touch screen.
excellent everything, another labor of love for retro platformers

‚Ä¢ Controls: Simple, responsive, delightful
‚Ä¢ Story: Just the right amount and wonderfully quirky
‚Ä¢ Difficulty: Perfect ramp-up from easy to challenging
‚Ä¢ In App Purchases: Nonexistent
‚Ä¢ Overall Experience: Incredible

Awesome weapons, brilliant soundtrack, and beautiful pixels in a non-ironic way!

From the creator of the smash indie hit "Cave Story" comes a brand-new platform shooter Kero Blaster!  Fight your way through seven unique worlds, collecting a variety of weapons and power-ups.

The gameplay feels like a blend of classic games like Megaman, Contra, and Metroid.  You can switch weapons at any time to fight enemies more effectively or simply use your favorite weapon.  My personal favorite was the green, multi-directional blaster.

The soundtrack is incredibly well done, and the melodies will stick with you even after you clear the game.  It has what most games fail to develop in their music: Personality.  It's unfortunate that there isn't an in-game jukebox offered after finishing the game.

Controls are crafted about as well as touch-devices will allow.  The gameplay gets hectic during the Boss Fights, but it never devolves into a virtual button-mash panic to survive.  The control scheme is simple.  With your left thumb, you move with Left/Right.  With your right thumb, you can choose to shoot Left, Right, or Up.  You also have a button to Jump.

The game is not too challenging for old-school platform game players, but don't let that dissuade you. This is as good as iOS platforming gets!  Highly recommended!  I even gifted a copy to my brother. And his Mother.  And then her boss, Charles.
Perfectly placed pixels, cute characters, challenging bosses and a catchy chiptune soundtrack. You can‚Äôt ask for much more!
Like an instant classic!

I love this game.  I really do, but when I downloaded it for my ipad (from the ipod App Store,) it worked fine at first.  Then, when I had it zoomed 2 times (for ipad screen size) it went into a strange slow motion state.  Everything was 2x slower, and would only go back to normal if I went into small screen mode. Please fix this, Pixel! You are the greatest indie dev of all time, and a good game like this can't be ruined by a simple bug!  Also, I rated this 5 stars because it is such a great game, and when it works it is the BEST ios platformer I have played to date.

My brother encouraged me to give it a try and I'm really glad I did. An exciting platformer/shooter, kero blaster kept me entertained for a whole week before I managed to beat it. The levels are challenging, the bosses are creative and fun. 

What sets this game apart though is the use of multiple weapons. I found myself switching between guns every few enemies to get the upper hand. I loved this mechanic and I wish I could see more variation like this in other platformers. 

If you're at all interested in platformers, buy this. It's well-worth the money.

title.label: This is how an iOS action game should be.

content.label: KeroBlaster just controls wonderfully. It is amazing how intelligently designed the controls of this game are. While I am sure many have played it on the PC, I guarantee it deserves another play on the iPhone to understand how important it is for gaming as a whole.

You die a lot, sometimes repetitive, overall good game, my only problem is that I wish that it had a sequel or spinoff that is equally fun. Thanks studio pixel! Discovered the game from swimmingbird914 on YouTube. Buy it now
